018package com.scivicslab.actoriac.log;
019
020import java.io.BufferedWriter;
021import java.io.FileWriter;
022import java.io.IOException;
023import java.io.PrintWriter;
024import java.nio.file.Path;
025import java.sql.*;
026import java.time.LocalDateTime;
027import java.time.ZoneId;
028import java.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
029import java.util.ArrayList;
030import java.util.List;
031import java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue;
032import java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue;
033import java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicBoolean;
034import java.util.logging.Logger;
035
036/**
037 * H2 Database implementation of DistributedLogStore.
038 *
039 * <p>Uses H2 embedded database for storing logs from distributed workflow
040 * execution. Supports concurrent access from multiple threads and provides
041 * efficient querying by node, level, and time.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>Features:</p>
044 * <ul>
045 *   <li>Pure Java - no native dependencies</li>
046 *   <li>Single file storage (.mv.db)</li>
047 *   <li>Asynchronous batch writing for performance</li>
048 *   <li>SQL-based querying</li>
049 * </ul>
050 *
051 * @author devteam@scivicslab.com
052 */
053public class H2LogStore implements DistributedLogStore {
054
055    private static final Logger LOG = Logger.getLogger(H2LogStore.class.getName());
056    private static final DateTimeFormatter ISO_FORMATTER =
057            DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ssXXX");
058    private static final ZoneId SYSTEM_ZONE = ZoneId.systemDefault();
059
060    private final Connection connection;
061    private final H2LogReader reader;
062    private final BlockingQueue<LogTask> writeQueue;
063    private final Thread writerThread;
064    private final AtomicBoolean running;
065    private static final int BATCH_SIZE = 100;
066
067    /**
068     * Optional text log file writer.
069     * When set, log entries are also written to this text file.
070     */
071    private PrintWriter textLogWriter;
072
073    /**
074     * Creates an H2LogStore with the specified database path.
075     *
076     * @param dbPath path to the database file (without extension)
077     * @throws SQLException if database connection fails
078     */
079    public H2LogStore(Path dbPath) throws SQLException {
080        // AUTO_SERVER=TRUE allows multiple processes to access the same DB
081        // First process starts embedded server, others connect via TCP
082        String url = "jdbc:h2:" + dbPath.toAbsolutePath().toString() + ";AUTO_SERVER=TRUE";
083        this.connection = DriverManager.getConnection(url);
084        this.reader = new H2LogReader(connection);
085        this.writeQueue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();
086        this.running = new AtomicBoolean(true);
087
088        initSchema();
089
090        // Start async writer thread
091        this.writerThread = new Thread(this::writerLoop, "H2LogStore-Writer");
092        this.writerThread.setDaemon(true);
093        this.writerThread.start();
094    }
095
096    /**
097     * Creates an in-memory H2LogStore (for testing).
098     *
099     * @throws SQLException if database connection fails
100     */
101    public H2LogStore() throws SQLException {
102        // Use unique DB name per instance to avoid test interference
103        String url = "jdbc:h2:mem:testdb_" + System.nanoTime() + ";DB_CLOSE_DELAY=-1";
104        this.connection = DriverManager.getConnection(url);
105        this.reader = new H2LogReader(connection);
106        this.writeQueue = new LinkedBlockingQueue<>();
107        this.running = new AtomicBoolean(true);
108
109        initSchema();
110
111        this.writerThread = new Thread(this::writerLoop, "H2LogStore-Writer");
112        this.writerThread.setDaemon(true);
113        this.writerThread.start();
114    }
115
116    /**
117     * Sets the text log file for additional text-based logging.
118     *
119     * <p>When a text log file is set, all log entries written to the database
120     * are also appended to this text file in a human-readable format.</p>
121     *
122     * @param textLogPath path to the text log file
123     * @throws IOException if the file cannot be opened for writing
124     */
125    public void setTextLogFile(Path textLogPath) throws IOException {
126        if (this.textLogWriter != null) {
127            this.textLogWriter.close();
128        }
129        this.textLogWriter = new PrintWriter(new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(textLogPath.toFile(), true)), true);
130        LOG.info("Text logging enabled: " + textLogPath);
131    }
132
133    /**
134     * Disables text file logging.
135     */
136    public void disableTextLog() {
137        if (this.textLogWriter != null) {
138            this.textLogWriter.close();
139            this.textLogWriter = null;
140        }
141    }
142
143    private void initSchema() throws SQLException {
144        initSchema(connection);
145    }
146
147    /**
148     * Initializes the log database schema on the given connection.
149     *
150     * <p>This method can be called from external components (e.g., log server)
151     * to ensure consistent schema across all database access points.</p>
152     *
153     * @param conn the database connection
154     * @throws SQLException if schema initialization fails
155     */
156    public static void initSchema(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
157        try (Statement stmt = conn.createStatement()) {
158            // Sessions table
159            stmt.execute("""
160                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS sessions (
161                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
162                    started_at TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
163                    ended_at TIMESTAMP,
164                    workflow_name VARCHAR(255),
165                    overlay_name VARCHAR(255),
166                    inventory_name VARCHAR(255),
167                    node_count INT,
168                    status VARCHAR(20) DEFAULT 'RUNNING',
169                    cwd VARCHAR(1000),
170                    git_commit VARCHAR(50),
171                    git_branch VARCHAR(255),
172                    command_line VARCHAR(2000),
173                    actoriac_version VARCHAR(50),
174                    actoriac_commit VARCHAR(50)
175                )
176                """);
177
178            // Logs table
179            // label and action_name use CLOB to store long YAML snippets
180            stmt.execute("""
181                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS logs (
182                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
183                    session_id BIGINT,
184                    timestamp TIMESTAMP DEFAULT CURRENT_TIMESTAMP,
185                    node_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
186                    label CLOB,
187                    action_name CLOB,
188                    level VARCHAR(10) NOT NULL,
189                    message CLOB,
190                    exit_code INT,
191                    duration_ms BIGINT,
192                    FOREIGN KEY (session_id) REFERENCES sessions(id)
193                )
194                """);
195
196            // Node results table
197            stmt.execute("""
198                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS node_results (
199                    id IDENTITY PRIMARY KEY,
200                    session_id BIGINT,
201                    node_id VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
202                    status VARCHAR(20) NOT NULL,
203                    reason VARCHAR(1000),
204                    FOREIGN KEY (session_id) REFERENCES sessions(id),
205                    UNIQUE (session_id, node_id)
206                )
207                """);
208
209            // Indexes
210            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_session ON logs(session_id)");
211            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_node ON logs(node_id)");
212            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_level ON logs(level)");
213            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_logs_timestamp ON logs(timestamp)");
214            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_workflow ON sessions(workflow_name)");
215            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_overlay ON sessions(overlay_name)");
216            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_inventory ON sessions(inventory_name)");
217            stmt.execute("CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_sessions_started ON sessions(started_at)");
218        }
219    }
220
221    private void writerLoop() {
222        List<LogTask> batch = new ArrayList<>(BATCH_SIZE);
223        while (running.get() || !writeQueue.isEmpty()) {
224            try {
225                LogTask task = writeQueue.poll(100, java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);
226                if (task != null) {
227                    batch.add(task);
228                    writeQueue.drainTo(batch, BATCH_SIZE - 1);
229                    processBatch(batch);
230                    batch.clear();
231                }
232            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
233                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
234                break;
235            }
236        }
237        // Process remaining
238        if (!batch.isEmpty()) {
239            processBatch(batch);
240        }
241    }
242
243    private void processBatch(List<LogTask> batch) {
244        try {
245            connection.setAutoCommit(false);
246            for (LogTask task : batch) {
247                task.execute(connection);
248            }
249            connection.commit();
250            connection.setAutoCommit(true);
251        } catch (SQLException e) {
252            try {
253                connection.rollback();
254                connection.setAutoCommit(true);
255            } catch (SQLException ex) {
256                // Ignore rollback errors
257            }
258            e.printStackTrace();
259        }
260    }
261
262    @Override
263    public long startSession(String workflowName, int nodeCount) {
264        return startSession(workflowName, null, null, nodeCount);
265    }
266
267    @Override
268    public long startSession(String workflowName, String overlayName, String inventoryName, int nodeCount) {
269        return startSession(workflowName, overlayName, inventoryName, nodeCount,
270                            null, null, null, null, null, null);
271    }
272
273    @Override
274    public long startSession(String workflowName, String overlayName, String inventoryName, int nodeCount,
275                             String cwd, String gitCommit, String gitBranch,
276                             String commandLine, String actorIacVersion, String actorIacCommit) {
277        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
278                "INSERT INTO sessions (workflow_name, overlay_name, inventory_name, node_count, " +
279                "cwd, git_commit, git_branch, command_line, actoriac_version, actoriac_commit) " +
280                "VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)",
281                Statement.RETURN_GENERATED_KEYS)) {
282            ps.setString(1, workflowName);
283            ps.setString(2, overlayName);
284            ps.setString(3, inventoryName);
285            ps.setInt(4, nodeCount);
286            ps.setString(5, cwd);
287            ps.setString(6, gitCommit);
288            ps.setString(7, gitBranch);
289            ps.setString(8, commandLine);
290            ps.setString(9, actorIacVersion);
291            ps.setString(10, actorIacCommit);
292            ps.executeUpdate();
293            try (ResultSet rs = ps.getGeneratedKeys()) {
294                if (rs.next()) {
295                    return rs.getLong(1);
296                }
297            }
298        } catch (SQLException e) {
299            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to start session", e);
300        }
301        return -1;
302    }
303
304    @Override
305    public void log(long sessionId, String nodeId, LogLevel level, String message) {
306        log(sessionId, nodeId, null, level, message);
307    }
308
309    @Override
310    public void log(long sessionId, String nodeId, String label, LogLevel level, String message) {
311        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.InsertLog(sessionId, nodeId, label, null, level, message, null, null));
312        writeToTextLog(nodeId, label, level, message);
313    }
314
315    @Override
316    public void logAction(long sessionId, String nodeId, String label,
317                          String actionName, int exitCode, long durationMs, String output) {
318        LogLevel level = parseLogLevelFromLabel(label, exitCode);
319        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.InsertLog(sessionId, nodeId, label, actionName, level, output, exitCode, durationMs));
320        writeToTextLog(nodeId, label, level, output);
321    }
322
323    /**
324     * Parses log level from the label parameter.
325     *
326     * <p>Maps java.util.logging levels to LogLevel:</p>
327     * <ul>
328     *   <li>SEVERE → ERROR</li>
329     *   <li>WARNING → WARN</li>
330     *   <li>INFO → INFO</li>
331     *   <li>CONFIG, FINE, FINER, FINEST → DEBUG</li>
332     * </ul>
333     */
334    private LogLevel parseLogLevelFromLabel(String label, int exitCode) {
335        if (label != null && label.startsWith("log-")) {
336            String levelName = label.substring(4).toUpperCase();
337            return switch (levelName) {
338                case "SEVERE" -> LogLevel.ERROR;
339                case "WARNING" -> LogLevel.WARN;
340                case "INFO" -> LogLevel.INFO;
341                case "CONFIG", "FINE", "FINER", "FINEST" -> LogLevel.DEBUG;
342                default -> exitCode == 0 ? LogLevel.INFO : LogLevel.ERROR;
343            };
344        }
345        return exitCode == 0 ? LogLevel.INFO : LogLevel.ERROR;
346    }
347
348    /**
349     * Writes a log entry to the text log file if enabled.
350     *
351     * @param nodeId the node identifier
352     * @param label the workflow label (may be null)
353     * @param level the log level
354     * @param message the log message
355     */
356    private void writeToTextLog(String nodeId, String label, LogLevel level, String message) {
357        if (textLogWriter == null) {
358            return;
359        }
360        String timestamp = LocalDateTime.now().atZone(SYSTEM_ZONE).format(ISO_FORMATTER);
361        String labelPart = label != null ? " [" + label + "]" : "";
362        textLogWriter.printf("%s %s %s%s %s%n", timestamp, level, nodeId, labelPart, message);
363    }
364
365    @Override
366    public void markNodeSuccess(long sessionId, String nodeId) {
367        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.UpdateNodeResult(sessionId, nodeId, "SUCCESS", null));
368    }
369
370    @Override
371    public void markNodeFailed(long sessionId, String nodeId, String reason) {
372        writeQueue.offer(new LogTask.UpdateNodeResult(sessionId, nodeId, "FAILED", reason));
373    }
374
375    @Override
376    public void endSession(long sessionId, SessionStatus status) {
377        // Flush pending writes
378        flushWrites();
379
380        try (PreparedStatement ps = connection.prepareStatement(
381                "UPDATE sessions SET ended_at = CURRENT_TIMESTAMP, status = ? WHERE id = ?")) {
382            ps.setString(1, status.name());
383            ps.setLong(2, sessionId);
384            ps.executeUpdate();
385        } catch (SQLException e) {
386            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to end session", e);
387        }
388    }
389
390    private void flushWrites() {
391        // Wait for queue to drain
392        while (!writeQueue.isEmpty()) {
393            try {
394                Thread.sleep(10);
395            } catch (InterruptedException e) {
396                Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
397                break;
398            }
399        }
400    }
401
402    @Override
403    public List<LogEntry> getLogsByNode(long sessionId, String nodeId) {
404        return reader.getLogsByNode(sessionId, nodeId);
405    }
406
407    @Override
408    public List<LogEntry> getLogsByLevel(long sessionId, LogLevel minLevel) {
409        return reader.getLogsByLevel(sessionId, minLevel);
410    }
411
412    @Override
413    public SessionSummary getSummary(long sessionId) {
414        return reader.getSummary(sessionId);
415    }
416
417    @Override
418    public long getLatestSessionId() {
419        return reader.getLatestSessionId();
420    }
421
422    @Override
423    public List<SessionSummary> listSessions(int limit) {
424        return reader.listSessions(limit);
425    }
426
427    @Override
428    public void close() throws Exception {
429        running.set(false);
430        writerThread.interrupt();
431        try {
432            writerThread.join(5000);
433        } catch (InterruptedException e) {
434            Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
435        }
436        if (textLogWriter != null) {
437            textLogWriter.close();
438            textLogWriter = null;
439        }
440        connection.close();
441    }
442
443    // Internal task classes for async writing
444    private interface LogTask {
445        void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException;
446
447        record InsertLog(long sessionId, String nodeId, String label, String actionName,
448                         LogLevel level, String message, Integer exitCode, Long durationMs) implements LogTask {
449            @Override
450            public void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
451                try (PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(
452                        "INSERT INTO logs (session_id, node_id, label, action_name, level, message, exit_code, duration_ms) " +
453                        "VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)")) {
454                    ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
455                    ps.setString(2, nodeId);
456                    ps.setString(3, label);
457                    ps.setString(4, actionName);
458                    ps.setString(5, level.name());
459                    ps.setString(6, message);
460                    if (exitCode != null) {
461                        ps.setInt(7, exitCode);
462                    } else {
463                        ps.setNull(7, Types.INTEGER);
464                    }
465                    if (durationMs != null) {
466                        ps.setLong(8, durationMs);
467                    } else {
468                        ps.setNull(8, Types.BIGINT);
469                    }
470                    ps.executeUpdate();
471                }
472            }
473        }
474
475        record UpdateNodeResult(long sessionId, String nodeId, String status, String reason) implements LogTask {
476            @Override
477            public void execute(Connection conn) throws SQLException {
478                try (PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(
479                        "MERGE INTO node_results (session_id, node_id, status, reason) KEY (session_id, node_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)")) {
480                    ps.setLong(1, sessionId);
481                    ps.setString(2, nodeId);
482                    ps.setString(3, status);
483                    ps.setString(4, reason);
484                    ps.executeUpdate();
485                }
486            }
487        }
488    }
489}
